properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 10 at 2:54PM MST until January 13 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Great Falls MT
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow occurring.
Additional snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches above 5000 feet,
2 to 5 inches below 5000 feet, and over 12 inches at the highest
peaks. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph, bringing periods of
blowing snow. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible.
Total snow accumulations of 5 to 12 inches, except 2 to 4 inches
at lower elevations possible. Winds could gust as high as 35
mph, also bringing periods of blowing snow.

* WHERE...Northern Rocky Mountain Front.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 AM MST Sunday.
For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Sunday morning through
Monday afternoon.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible.
Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 45 below zero could
cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Increased avalanche danger is possible,
especially across steep terrain.
properties.instruction:
Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST SUNDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON
